meanings.definition: A gunfight or battle in which people shoot at each other.
meanings.sent1: The cowboys engaged in shootouts at high noon.
meanings.sent2: The police were involved in a dangerous shootout with the criminals.
meanings.sent3: The shootout at the OK Corral was quite the spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The shootout between the rival gangs was like a scene from a movie.
meanings.sent5: The shootout left the town in chaos and fear.

meanings.definition: A decisive contest or confrontation, especially in sports.
meanings.sent1: The soccer match ended in a thrilling shootout.
meanings.sent2: The basketball game was decided by a shootout between the top players.
meanings.sent3: The shootout on the field determined the champion of the league.
meanings.sent4: The shootout between the two teams was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent5: The shootout in the final moments of the game had everyone on the edge of their seats.
